name: sfchronicle
text: Hanging up your apron on Bon Appetit? @hooleil suggests you check out these non-mainstream food publications instead: https://t.co/wsjcVRK8nY

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mayor Breed will introduce a proposal for the Nov. ballot to reform SF’s patchwork of business taxes and potentially unlock around $300 million in revenues that have been collected but are off-limits because of legal disputes. Story by @DominicFracassa 

https://t.co/eU97HE1fqA

name: sfchronicle
text:
We've added new openings to our map of all the beaches, trails and parks you can visit in the San Francisco Bay Area right now.

https://t.co/nwKQYMraK7

name: sfchronicle
text: Will Fort Bragg change its name? Voters might get to decide, amid national calls for names and statues honoring the Confederacy to be removed. https://t.co/zHizyb86k2

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mayor London Breed will introduce a sweeping proposal for the November ballot to reform San Francisco's patchwork of business taxes, potentially unlocking around $300 million in collected revenues that remain off-limits due to ongoing legal disputes.

https://t.co/ahcWY6WC26

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Board of Supervisors will vote Tuesday whether the city should apply for local control over its reopening plan. If the state grants the request, San Francisco will be able to set its own timetable for lifting restrictions.
https://t.co/FSEYnTuTvL

name: sfchronicle
text:
Dozens of protesters drive through the affluent East Bay suburb and parked at the house of Contra Costa County Sheriff David Livingston in a loud, but peaceful protest.
https://t.co/LgrX9XG4a2

name: sfchronicle
text: In a landmark vote, University of California regents moved toward repealing Prop. 209, the affirmative action ban passed in 1996. https://t.co/s2Luubdn0J

name: sfchronicle
text: Over 100 sworn declarations from inmates say that California prison staff "routinely use unnecessary and excessive force against people with disabilities." https://t.co/4SKX3QD21p

name: sfchronicle
text: Calif. AG Xavier Becerra calls for legislation that would help decertify police officers for serious misconduct — a type of accountability platform that has been long missing in a state that prides itself on criminal justice reforms. https://t.co/yOfc59WauL https://t.co/RlKPDBCNJ3

name: sfchronicle
text:
The 2020 virtual celebration of Pride — a live-streamed program set for June 27-28 — may go down in history as one of the most memorable iterations of the LGBTQ cultural event.

https://t.co/ZkQy6RKwHn

name: sfchronicle
text: Gone With the Wind: Re-framing its historical context "takes us from passive viewers to participants in a dialogue and can turn art into a learning experience," says @TonyBravoSF: https://t.co/hETYo4TTJk,

text:
